name: Activity Sensor (Neural)
description: Activity Sensors detect thought activity (based on the principles of Perception). Most of the device is carried via an ergonomic backpack.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Atmosphere Tester
description: The Atmosphere Tester is a portable Analyzer/Sniffer, which detects volatiles in space and (more usually) in atmosphere. Contained in an ergonomic, handheld case, with a sling for carrying over the shoulder.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Binox, Binocs (Binoculars)
description: Improves vision by 1 range band. Also available as Trinox, Quadnox, Quintnox for sophonts with more than two eyes.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Biosniffer
description: A "BioSniffer" / Life Detector senses the presence of organisms (based on the principles of Perception). Contained in an ergonomic, handheld case, with a sling for carrying over the shoulder.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Bug Detector
description: The bug detector locates hidden surveillance devices.Surveillance devices may include microphones, cameras, or other sensors.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Compass
description: A pocket-sized device that indicates magnetic north if the world has magnetic poles.Close proximity to large iron deposits may influence the compass and provide false readings.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Camera
description: SLR/DSLR camera. The camera records still images on analog (SLR) or digital (DSLR) media. Cameras normally require a certain level of ambient luminosity to function although there are specialized cameras that work in non-visible spectra.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Radar, Deep
description: Deep Radar is a world sensor that is capable of mapping underground density structures. It is a lower tech equivalent of a Densitometer and is typically contained in a backpack.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Densitometer
description: The densitometer is a world sensor that is capable of mapping underground density structures.The densitometer is typically contained in a backpack.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Electromagnetic Sensor (EMS), Active
description: Sophisticated form of radar. The signals from the EMS are subjected to aggressive computer analysis for detailed information. The unit projects radio pulses in sweeping scans of an area and interprets the returned signals (echoes) for information about an object's size, distance, and speed.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Electromagnetic Sensor (EMS), Passive
description: Sophisticated form of radar. The EMS senses existing electromagnetic radiation (including emissions by the target, reflected local energy, and occluded background energy. The signals are subjected to aggressive computer analysis for detailed information about the size, distance, and speed of objects in the area.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Field Sensor
description: Field Sensors are multi-purpose detectors sensitive to electric and magnetic fields. They operate in much the way Awareness operates. These devices are typically contained in an ergonomic, handheld case, with a sling for carrying over the shoulder.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: HoloVisor MP
description: The HoloVisor is the ultimate vision screen system. The device uses external light detectors and displays them in 3D projection. Computer enhancements fill in gaps, extrapolate unseen sides of objects, and maintain a complete image in memory).

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Magnet, Industrial
description: A small alnico (aluminum-nickel-cobalt alloy) horseshoe magnet capable of lifting 1kg against 1G.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Metal Detector
description: The metal detector indicates presence of most metals. The degree of reaction depends on the amount of metal present and its proximity.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Motion Sensor
description: The motion sensor detects movement using a matched pair of emitters/receivers. The size of the unit determines the range and detection arc based on the number of emitter/receiver pairs).

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Neutrino Detector MP
description: The neutrino detector measures the level of neutrinos in a given direction. Neutrinos primarily occur as the byproduct of fusion reactions, so positive readings may reflect the presence of fusion reactors or nuclear activity. Because neutrinos are almost impossible to shield, Neutrino Detectors are effective in sensing ships through their Power Plants (although not APlants or Collectors). They can also detect Fusion+ modules. Ships can frustrate Neutrino Detectors by turning off the Power Plant.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Position Tracker (Ballistic)
description: The ballistic position tracker determines the location in three dimensions relative to a specified waypoint. All information is scrambled if the user travels in a grav vehicle or is under the influence of inertial compensators.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Position Tracker (Satellite)
description: The satellite position tracker determines the location in three dimensions based on orbiting satellites. This device will not work underground or in large buildings.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Position Tracker (Beacon Position)
description: The beacon position tracker determines the location in three dimensions based on a beacon (usually a starship on the ground). This device will not function if the beacon is beyond the horizon.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Pressure Gauge
description: Handheld device for testing atmospheric air pressure. Includes an adapter for testing the pressure in various small containers such as tires.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Proximeter
description: A Proximeter senses objects close by. It serves as an accurate motion detector, closeup altimeter, depth gauge, and as an alert device when objects (people, aliens) approach. Contained in an ergonomic, handheld case, with a sling for carrying over the shoulder.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Radar
description: Radar projects radio pulses in sweeping scans of an area and interprets the returned signals (echoes) for information about an objects size, distance, and speed.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Radiation Detector
description: The radiation detector indicates the presence and intensity of radioactivity. The radiation detector can be preset to give a warning signal if the levels of radioactivity rise to dangerous levels. It is a more limited, lower tech equivalent of a neutrino detector. The radiation detector is contained in an ergonomic, handheld case, with a sling for carrying over the shoulder.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Scanner
description: The scanner is an advanced form of electromagnetic sensor (EMS).The scanner senses existing electromagnetic radiation (including emissions by the target, reflected local energy, and occluded background energy. The signals received are subjected to aggressive computer analysis for detailed information about the size, distance, and speed of objects in the area.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Scope MP
description: Scope is vision screen with distance and enhancement capabilities. It acquires images and magnifies them for interaction, navigation, and analysis.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Sentry Kit
description: Motion detectors and life form scanners for those more dangerous camp-outs. The sentry kit lets you sleep in (moderate) peace while it keeps watch. The kit is capable of identifying friend / foe (IFF) and can be programmed to operate weapons that have the "Remote" modified for automated defense.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Sound Sensor
description: The sound sensor is a multi-function device that provides sound recording, echo sounding, and echo location in addition to its main function as a sound detector. The sound sensor is contained in an ergonomic, handheld case with a sling for carrying over the shoulder.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Spectrum Goggles
description: The spectrum goggles provide PRGBC (visible spectrum _P_urple - _R_ed - _G_reen - _B_lue - _C_erise_) vision.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Stealth Mask MP
description: The stealth mask is a signal absorber. The device (actually an external coating) absorbs or diverts Active sensor signals. The stealth mask can be switched On and Off.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Telescope
description: The telescope provides the capability to view a target by decreasing the apparent distance by 2 range bands.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Video Recorder
description: The video recorder provides the capability to record moving images and sound to analog or digital media.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Vision Goggles
description: Vision goggles intensify the ambient light, easing vision in low light situations.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Watch (TL 4)
description: A chronometer worn on the wrist or carried in the pocket.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Watch (TL 7)
description:
A chronometer worn on the wrist or carried in the pocket.This device is waterproof to a depth of 3 (TL - 4) and includes the following functions

  • Alarm
  • Calculator
  • Chronograph
  • Chronometer
  • Pedwatch

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Watch, Cool
description: Non-military timepiece, with stats like the typical watch.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures
